title: So, This is What Our Beloved League Has Come To
body:
I just queued up for a game, hoping to progress my Syndra gameplay level to a level 4 mastery. All was going well, and I called "mid" before the other people did, like normal. 

Then, all of a sudden, this other summoner joins in late, way late, and insta-locks Ezreal, and types in all-caps "MID". I thought he was kidding, so I playfully type, "Ummm Ezreal, I called mid" to which he responds, "HAHA SUCK IT I GOT MID". 

Now, I was a little mad. All I wanted was to play a normal game, and here comes this other summoner and ruins my day. 

So we then go and play out the match, lose, unfortunately yet obviously, and I come to the post-game screen. My team mates are all, "So I should report him, right? For Refusing to Communicate with our team?" And I respond, "No, don't. Reporting someone in normals doesn't punish the other person at all." And the mean Ezreal responds, "Yeah, report me all you want, but I will still play this game." 

So yeah. I'm pretty much out of anything to say.

replies.body:
Reporting is just as effective in normals as it is in ranked. Only 2 differences really:
1) There's no prisoners' island to send them to in normals (ranked gets sent to normals draft)
2) People are less likely to report in normals games.
- 2.5) It's worth noting that the system only counts 1 report each game regardless of mode (to prevent group queue abuse). Though all reports are read.

As a result, it takes *longer* for people playing normals to be identified and to be punished.

-----------------------------------

I had a particularly amusing cr+p shoot earlier today that followed this model.
**Short version:** we ended up with a new Vayne going solo top, Support Darius and J4, Jungle Shaco and Yi.
The communication was so bad it looped back around and evolved into hilarity.

Sounds more like a ban from ranked, than a "prisoner's island," as he called it.  Prisoner's island as it is normally defined allows you to continue to queue up for ranked but places you with other players who are also repeat offenders.

I think the concept he was envisioning in terms of normals draft being PI is that during ranked restriction negative players HAVE to play a certain number of normals draft to be allowed back in ranked so negative all layers end up there. To avoid them as much as it is possible to do, players who have never been even chat restricted like myself, just play ranked and maybe the occasional team builder or something. Then the majority of players in normals draft are negative players and sometimes they can end up feeding into the rage of other players and getting reported and continuing their restriction so normals becomes a more toxic environment that is difficult for players to improve behavior in, and thus toxic behavior gets stuck there and just feeds it self.

"Calling" roles doesn't mean anything, Riot's official stance on it has been that it doesn't matter for years now. Whether or not you computer loads faster or you can type (or lock in) faster gives you absolutely no authority over what anyone else on your team does. 



> Then, all of a sudden, this other summoner joins in late, way late, and insta-locks Ezreal, and types in all-caps "MID". I thought he was kidding, so I playfully type, "Ummm Ezreal, I called mid" to which he responds, "HAHA SUCK IT I GOT MID". 



Yep that's blind pick. Don't play blind pick. If you want to play a specific champ/position, play Team Builder, if you want teamwork, play Draft. Blind Pick is the land of nobody cares about anybody else at all.
> 
>And I respond, "No, don't. Reporting someone in normals doesn't punish the other person at all."

Wrong, reports in Normals have exactly the same weight as reports in Ranked. Seriously where did you even get the idea they didn't?


Finally, none of this has anything at all to do with "what league has come to." Every single element of it has been here forever, except that years (like, 2 or 3...) ago Riot took no stance on pick order vs call order. Then they did, and they chose to endorse pick order and not call order.
